item.title: Report X-2025020055
item.description:
Report X-2025020055

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-05T03:26:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-16
  • City: SAN DIEGO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 1/16/2025 at approximately 1000, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 4835830 at the heavyweight facility in San Diego, reporting a paint spill. The shipment consisted of 10 buckets of paint that were overpacked onto a wooden pallet. The shipment sustained damage due to a forklift incident. 1 of the 10 buckets was punctured, resulting in spillage. The damaged bucket was inverted and placed in a salvage drum for disposal. The remaining pieces of the shipment will continue forward in transit upon receipt of an amended Shipper's Declaration of Dangerous Goods.

item.title: Report X-2025011321
item.description:
Report X-2025011321

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-04T06:26:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-30
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UNDECLARED HAZMAT PACKAGE CAME FROM LOADSIDE WET, TORN AND RETAPED. DAMAGED DURING OVERHEAD SORTATION. LIMITED QUANTITY MARKING OBSCURED BY SHIPPING LABEL. ONE BOTTLE MISSING. THREE BOTTLES LEAKED FROM CAPS OFF OR LOOSE. ALL GOODS SOILED. SPILL COLLECTED WITH ABSORBENT MATERIALS. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2025011302
item.description:
Report X-2025011302

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-04T06:26:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-22
  • City: BLOOMINGTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was damaged at facility RLTO. No DPR was done, nor was it entered into DGnav. Package was repacked and forwarded to destination MPGR without an LQ diamond on the new outer packaging. Cannot confirm whether or not the original packaging had an LQ diamond, and as a result I am entering this as undeclared. Package discovered by QA while working damaged packages and was flagged as a hazmat. 2 bottles in package. Both damaged.

item.title: Report X-2025011265
item.description:
Report X-2025011265

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-01T00:52:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-16
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UPON ARRIVAL TO LOCAL SORT SHIFT RESPONDER DISCOVERED A PACKAGE LEFT IN THE HAZAMT PROCESSING AREA WITH A NOTE THAT SHIPMENT CONTAINED 71 LBS OF UNDECLARED AMMUNITION, RESPONDER CONTACTED PRELOAD AND STATED THAT THIS BOX WAS REWRAPPED AND UPON DOING SO IS WHEN THEY DISCOVERED THE UNDECLARED AMMUNITION, THEN CALLED THE HAZMAT HELPLINE WHICH ADVISED TO REPORT.

item.title: Report E-2025010398
item.description:
Report E-2025010398

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-01T00:52:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-29
  • City: COSTA MESA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG West Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6580
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG West Energy, LLC driver inadvertently opened a valve on the trailer prior to connecting the delivery hose to the customer's storage tank. This allowed approximately 20 gallons of gasoline to be released. Clean Harbors Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The customer stated that the battery started to swell while charging the phone. The screen and phone body separation was a pre-existing condition not caused by the battery. The phone never caught fire and was placed in the TCB for precautionary measures. The empty TCB is in the hazmat locker in the baggage service at SFO. The passenger took his phone and will be purchasing a new one before his next flight segment on 01/21/2025. 1

item.title: Report X-2025010848
item.description:
Report X-2025010848

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-15
  • City: FONTANA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Union Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 1/15/2025 container UMXU 931000 was reported to be actively leaking towards the middle of the container. UPRR Hazmat and contractor responded and found one 250-gallon tote of UN 1987 releasing from the bottom offloading valve. The load the shifted from inadequate blocking and bracing causing another tote to damage the offloading valve. The damaged tote was transferred into a new 250-gallon tote and all impacted were cleaned up.

item.title: Report E-2025010323
item.description:
Report E-2025010323

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-27
  • City: KETTLEMAN CTY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 06:30 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (UKC) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to a loose cap, approximately 2 ounces of Nalco 5711 (hazardous - UN1760) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the top of the tote and did not impact the trailer floor. The caller advised there was a hole at the top of the tote but called back to advise that the tote had a loose cap. The terminal advised they did not want a contractor out to clean and contained the released product. The released product and soak pads will be placed into a 5-gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report I-2025010077
item.description:
Report I-2025010077

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-20
  • City: Los Angeles
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Customer came to the back of the aircraft to alert us, that his backpack had gotten wet some how and the batteries in his computers were hissing and you could smell a burning smell. We put them in the Fire containment bag. I then went to customers seat to find out how his bag got wet and he said, he didn't know, but his whole bag was wet and everything in it. He said, he had no water in his bag at all. At that moment, the guy in seat 15D, turns around and says, that he spilled a little water under his seat, where customers bag was stowed. It wasn't little water, it was a lot of water. Anyway, two managers met the flight and took both gentlemen off the plane for questioning. Considered this to be more of a short circuiting of laptop than a thermal runaway. Water can sizzle in electrified circuitry.
